gurmukhi: bIs bwx kumqih qIs kukrmh BydXo ] ds swiek dwirdR kwm keI bwxin CydXo ]
transliteration: Bees Baan Koumatah(i) Tees Koukarmah Bhedyo|| Das Saaek Daaridra Kaam Kai Baanan(i) Chhidyo||
translation: Kumat was pierced with twenty arrows and Kukaram with thirty arrows; ten arrows were shot at Daridarta and Kaam was pierced with many arrows;

gurmukhi: bhu ibiD ibroD ko bD kIXo Aibbykih sr sMiD rx ] rx roh kRoh krvwr gih iem sMjm bu`lXo bXx ]96]323]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Birodh Do Badh Keeyo Abibekah(i) Sar Sandh(i) Ran|| Ran Roh Kroh Karvaar Gadh Im Sanjam Bullyo Bayan||96||323||
translation: The warrior Avivek killed the warrior Virodh in the war-arena; Sanjam said, while taking up sword in his hand and getting infuriated in the battlefield.96.323.

gurmukhi: Arx p`Cmih augÍY bruxu au`qr ids q`kY ] myr pMK kir aufy srb swier jl su`kY ]
transliteration: Aran Pachchhmah(i) Ougvai Baroun(u) Outtar Dis Takkai|| Mer Pankh Kar(i) Ude Sarab Saair Jal Soukkai||
translation: Even if the sun rises in the West or the clouds begin to come from the North; if the Meru mountain flies and all the water of the ocean is dried up;

gurmukhi: kol dwVH kV muVY ismit PnIAr Px P`tY ] aulit jwnvI bhY s`q hrI cMdY h`tY ]
transliteration: Kol Daadh Kad Mudai Simattee Phaneear Phaan Phattai|| Ulattee Jaanvibahai Satt Harichanndai Hattai||
translation: Even if the teeth of KAL are bent and the hood of Sheshnaga is overturned; even if the Ganges flows contrarily and Harish Chandra may forsake the path of truth;

gurmukhi: sMswr aul`t pul`t hÍY Dsik Daul DrxI PtY ] suin niRp Aibbyk ibbyk Bit q`dip n lit sMjm htY ]97]324]
transliteration: Sansaar Ullatt Pulatt Hvai Dhasak(i) Dhaul Dharniphatai|| Soun(i) Nrip Abibek Bibek Bhattee Taddap(i) Na Lattee Sanjam Hatai||97||324||
translation: Even if the world is upturned and the earth stabilized on the back of the bull may burst while sinking, but O king Avivek, the heroic discipline of Vivek will not step back even then.97.324.

gurmukhi: qyry jor mY guMgw khqw ho ] qyrw sdkw qyrI Srix ]
transliteration: Dere Jor Mai Goungad Kahtaa Ho|| Teraa Sadkaa Terisharan(i)||
translation: I, a dumbed one, speak with your grace, I am a sacrifice to you and under your refuge.

gurmukhi: kupXo sMjmM prm joDw juJwrM ] bfo grbDwrI bfo inribkwrM ]
transliteration: Koupyo Sanjamannd Parm Jodhaa Jujhaa Jujhaaran|| Bado Gadbdhaaribado Nirbikaaran||
translation: The great warrior Sanjam got infuriated; he was proud and vice-less;

gurmukhi: AnMqwsqR lY kY AnrQY pHwrXo ] Anwd`q ky AMg ko Cyd fwrXo ]98]325]
transliteration: Anantaastra Lai Kai Anarthai Prahdaryo|| Anaadatt Ke An Ko Ched Ddaryo||98||325||
translation: Taking up his innumerable arms, he attacked Anarth and pierced the limbs of Anadat.98.325.

gurmukhi: ieso ju`Du bIqXo khw lO sunwaU ] rto shMs ijhvw n qaU AMq n pwaU ]
transliteration: Iso Juddh(u) Beetyo Kahaa Lau Sounaaoo|| Rato Sahans Jihvaa Na Taoo Ant Na Paaoo||
translation: There was such a war to what extent I should described it ?; If I speak with thousand of tongues, even then I cannot know the end;

gurmukhi: dsM l`C jugXM su brKM AnMqM ] BXo bIr KyqM kQY kaun AMqM ]99]326]
transliteration: Dasan Lachchh Jougyan Su Barkhanndanantan|| Bhayo Beer Khetan Kathai Kaoun Antan||99||326||
translation: The war continued for the years of ten lakh ages and innumerable warriors died.99.326.

gurmukhi: BeI AMD DuMDM mcXo bIr KyqM ] nrI ju`gxI cwru caus`T pRyqM ]
transliteration: Bhaiandh Dhoundhan Machyo Beer Khetan|| Nachijudgadichaar(u) Chaousatth Pretan||
translation: There was blind and rash destruction in war; the sixty-four Yoginis and the fiends danced;
